subject: RE: [junit] Bug in JUnit Swing UI
msgSnippet: Thanks, that fixed it! I m curious. That problem is pretty well hidden unless you add menus to JUnit. How was this problem originally discovered?
messageBody:
Thanks, that fixed it! I'm curious. That problem is pretty well hidden
unless you add menus to JUnit. How was this problem originally discovered?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vladimir Bossicard [mailto:vladimir@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 15, 2002 1:25 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Bug in JUnit Swing UI
>
>
> > To be more precise it is not just those labels but everything in the
> > junit.swingui.CounterPanel() class that is obscuring any
> dropped down menu.
> > It appears to be some sort of Z-order repaint problem
>
> The CounterPanel must extend JPanel and not Panel. This is fixed in the
> cvs version.
>
> -Vladimir
>
> --
> Vladimir Bossicard
> www.bossicard.com
